data.prayer: Spirit, reveal best practices for sharing the gospel in the state of Tokat.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Tokat, Turkey
data.section_summary: What needs would people have here?

data.prayer: Father, let those from the 225 believers who are shaken and weak remember that your love will never fail them.
data.verse: Love never fails. But where there are prophecies, they will be done away with. Where there are various languages, they will cease. Where there is knowledge, it will be done away with.

data.label_1: One disciple of Jesus for every 2660 lost neighbors

data.prayer: Father, grace the churches in Tokat, Turkey with faithful local leaders.
data.verse: Where there is no guidance, a people falls, but in an abundance of counselors there is safety.

data.prayer: Father, help your children in Tokat, Turkey find someone like the Samaritan Woman today. Someone who will open an entire town to your message of salvation.
data.verse: So the woman left her water jar and went away into town and said to the people, 29 “Come, see a man who told me all that I ever did. Can this be the Christ?” They went out of the town and were coming to him.

data.prayer: Father, open to your people a door for the word, to speak the mystery of Christ to the Arab, Syrian people.
Spirit, please give new believers a yearning to see you praised in Tokat, Turkey.
data.verse: Declare his glory among the nations, his marvelous deeds among all peoples.

data.prayer: Spirit, fill the 598,700 souls living in the state of Tokat with a taste for your Word. Make it sweet as honey in their mouth.
data.verse: How sweet are your words to my taste, sweeter than honey to my mouth!

data.prayer: Spirit, renew the call of John the Baptist in the state of Tokat. Send out bold servants who will call all to repent.
data.verse: Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.

location.name: Tokat
location.people_groups_list: Abaza, Adyghe, Azerbaijani, Azeri Turk, Jew, Turkish, Alawite
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Abaza (14,000), Adyghe (350,000), Azerbaijani, Azeri Turk (590,000), Jew, Turkish (5,500), Alawite (554,000)
